transcripts.text: Why is there a glow around this dog in this thermal camera footage?  Why is there a glow around this dancing girl?  Or around this guy?  Black is hot here in these videos.  The glow is white.  So why are they surrounded by a blob of cold air?  Why is this jet surrounded by a cold glow?  Or these engines here?  Or this jet?  Could it be that the dog, the people, and the jets each have some kind of alien technology anti-gravity generators that are warping space around them and somehow cooling the air?  No, of course not.  It's obviously just an artifact of the thermal camera system, not alien technology.  And yet alien technology is exactly what some people are claiming about the same glow seen in the gimbal video.
Ancient astronaut theorist Mike Barra.  and aerospace engineer Travis Taylor are meeting with Hollywood visual effects supervisor Sam Edwards.
There's no such thing as a light source that follows around behind an aircraft.

So the system is in black hot mode.  What that tells me, if black is hot, there's a cold region.  You typically are going to be, you know, warm coming out of the exhaust or near your engine or whatever.
Doesn't that argue that it's not a conventional propulsion system?  And here's another one.

The gimbal craft.  It's been recently analyzed.  It's FLIR.  Not only does it, it's definitive that it's not a conventional anything by its movements, but there's a pocket of cold air around a propulsion source.

It even made the New York Times describe there as a glowing aura.  But all this glow, this aura, this cold warping of space-time actually is, is a contrast enhancement in the camera that highlights the edges.  It's a filter called an Unsharp Mask, sometimes used to give a slight sharpening in photography or video.  It's a simple filter, easy to add to a camera.  Thermal camera footage is often low contrast, and people using it for surveillance, like law enforcement or military, don't care so much about the aesthetics, so they often crank it up, which gives you the glow, but really makes the heat sources stand out against the background.  All the videos I showed you at the start had this effect, except for the dog one.  I added that myself so you can see what it looks like.  Unsharp mask?  No mask.  Unsharp mask?  No mask.  So no.  The glow around the gimbal UFO is not evidence of advanced alien technology.  It's the sharpening in the camera, cranked up to 11.  If you've got experts telling you otherwise, maybe you should look at what else they are telling you.  Even experts sometimes make mistakes.
